emergency_sos_tips.title: General Emergency
tips: Stay calm and assess the situation before taking action.
Call campus security or emergency services immediately.
Avoid spreading panic and follow official safety instructions.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Medical Emergency
tips: Contact the ABU Medical Center or the nearest hospital.
If someone is unconscious, check their breathing and pulse before performing CPR if trained.
Do not move an injured person unless they are in immediate danger.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Fire Outbreak
tips: Activate the nearest fire alarm and call emergency services.
Evacuate the building using the nearest exit; do not use elevators.
Cover your nose with a cloth to avoid inhaling smoke.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Security Threat
tips: If you notice suspicious activity, report it to campus security immediately.
Avoid walking alone at night; use designated safe routes.
Keep personal belongings secure and do not share sensitive information with strangers.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Natural Disaster (Floods, Earthquake, etc.)
tips: Follow official university instructions and seek shelter if needed.
Stay away from windows and heavy objects that might fall.
If outside, move to an open area away from buildings and trees.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Sexual Harassment or Assault
tips: Report incidents to the universityâ€™s student affairs office or security.
Seek support from trusted friends, family, or a counselor.
Know your rights and take legal action if necessary.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Transportation Safety
tips: Use only trusted campus shuttles or registered transportation services.
Avoid entering unregistered vehicles, especially at night.
Be alert and aware of your surroundings while commuting.

emergency_sos_tips.title: Mental Health Crisis
tips: If you or someone you know is experiencing distress, reach out to a counselor.
Avoid isolation and talk to a trusted friend or university support group.
Engage in relaxation techniques such as deep breathing or meditation.
